title: Quartic reciprocity
summary: Quartic or  biquadratic reciprocity is a collection of theorems in elementary and algebraic  number theory that state conditions under which the congruence x4 ≡ p (mod q) is solvable; the word "reciprocity" comes from the form of some of these theorems, in that they relate the solvability of the congruence x4 ≡ p (mod q) to that of x4 ≡ q (mod p).
